intro: Buphthalmum alpicola, commonly known as the alpine sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, sunny conditions. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Buphthalmum alpicola is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
